snippet: Pointing to massive inequality in the city, Bill de Blasio said that 46 percent of New Yorkers live at or near the poverty line. Indeed, according to an analysis by the Bloomberg administration in April, about 46 percent of New Yorkers were making...
abstract: Pointing to massive inequality in the city, Bill de Blasio said that 46 percent of New Yorkers live at or near the poverty line. Indeed, according to an analysis by the Bloomberg administration in April, about 46 percent of New Yorkers were making less than 150 percent of the federal poverty threshold — a benchmark intended to include families who are poor and those who are not officially poor but who struggle to get by.

headline.main: Fact-Check: New Yorkers Living at or Near Poverty Line
headline.kicker: Fact-Checking de Blasio vs. Lhota: Round 1
